Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet and cheap.”
Reviews.Author: Mommyoftwins01
Reviews.Content: I went with my husband and 3 kids the week before the Easter weekend and it was peaceful and quiet. We needed to get away from the Metro area to find some peace and we really found it here. The staff was friendly and the cottage, #1, was nice and clean. It has a kitchen with fridge, electric stove, two bedrooms (1 full bed and 2 twin beds) and 2 bathrooms. TV with plenty of channels and a nice big balcony with a table and chairs. There's a barbecue pit just outside our cottage and the beach is just steps away. The pools were nice although the kids loved the beach more. The only complaint I have is the Wi-fi signal is very poor. I was told that I could sit in the playground across from the reception area and still get a wi-fi signal. Instead, I had to sit inside the reception closest to the desk to get a barely fair signal. There are a lot of restaurants and a bakery in the area. We really loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Average for amount paid”
Reviews.Author: Icogoodday
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is nice but the hotel is too old and outdated. Needs rÃ©novations. The staff was ok. Wouldn't recommend unless people have Ã  very small budget and just a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and 5 steps to the feeling of sand between your toes!!”
Reviews.Author: inspector63
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for two nights on our road trip of Porte del Sol area. We had unit 31 which is closest to the beach and obvioulsy, the Carribean waters. It was a modest ground floor unit decorated in 70's style but very clean and has a small cement porch. There is another unit above but it was vacant. The unit consisted of 3 rooms...main living area and kitchen combo...with a fridge and 4 burner stove with oven..they provide a few pots, utensils, can opener...very basic..but there was frozen ice in the two ice cube trays which was a treat for a cold refreshment( which we had with us) after a long day of touring. Just pull up a seat at the kitchen island on one of the three bar stools and sip away. There is also a small wicker couch, chair and TV.which has a good channel selection. Also a small table and two chairs. The bedroom consisted of clean sheets and a dresser, closet and a single and a double bed with a window AC which worked marvelously(if you like air conditioning). Off the bedroom is a bathroom..the shower is large and everything worked. It is not the ritz but the location was phenomenal. Quiet and set back in a little from the sand beach. They have wi fi in the main office and a few things like dish soap, books, sun tan or sun block..whatever your preference. There is a barbecue pit outside beside the unit and also some tables and chairs outside under a cabana. Overall, we enjoyed our stay very much, the staff was friendly, the price was great and it provided us options for meals and basic necessities. I would recommend this villa for a family or couples or even a group of friends and it will not kill your pocket book. You can walk to all kinds of restaurants, liquor stores and supermarkets. Very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lici3
Reviews.Content: I was afraid after reading some of the reviews, but we paid in advance and there was no choice to cancel and we are glad we went. It is a very nice place but very simple...no luxury but very clean with a small kitchen in the balcony. The place is oceanfront and have a beautiful sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but no sleep”
Reviews.Author: monicacaguas
Reviews.Content: The location is great near restaurants, jet ski rentals, and a beautiful beach. Outdoors is not bad rustic but okay. The intolerable thing is the noisy rooms DONT stay here unless in a third floor isolated ,no parking front room (i dont know if that exist there). Dont book here it is a shame. Rooms are old but okay , not really clean but okay. BUT you can not sleep. Cars are parked in front of apartments so alarms beeping, people talking while using the stairs, upper floor furniture moving,etc. etc. The administration should take care of this issues; plan another parking area, put windows that isolates sounds and carpets to avoid the furniture moving sounds.

Reviews.Title: “Very simple, don't expect much!”
Reviews.Author: cleeamon
Reviews.Content: Does the trick, but not much going on in this little town. Don't go on holidays, as everything in town is closed! The hotel Confresi next door to the Villa Antonio is more happening, but definitely like a way-too- loud Holiday Inn. Not much in the way of restaurants either in Rincon. Overall, descent hotel, bland little town.

Reviews.Title: “Worst nightmare ever!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ivan037
Reviews.Content: Its not a family place to stay!!! The administration supports all the misbehavior from every guest , no security !!!! Im not kidding!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: monche007
Reviews.Content: I'm currently staying at villa Antonio. We have what they call a "beachfront cottage" which is advertised as their best room. Despite having a great location, the room itself is definitely overpriced. The furniture is old, broken, and needed replacing about 20 yrs ago. Even worse, I was able to break into my room in less than 3 seconds, which speaks volumes for their security. I have small children, and anywhere where there's sand and water they're happy, but I am glad I'm not paying close to $200 a night for this. I would've rather stayed at a Holiday inn express and driven to a nearby beach every day. By the way, I was born and raised in PR, but have lived in the US for 20 yrs. In fact I stayed here 30 yrs ago, and was much nicer. If what u want is sunset and NOTHING else, this is your place. Otherwise, pay more and go somewhere decent , cause you will regret it - I know we are!

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful Which Room You Book”
Reviews.Author: Beachy722Maryland
Reviews.Content: First, when we arrived at this hotel, we did not find the name "Parador" anywhere. The sign just said "Villa Antonio" so it was a little confusing in finding it. I have never written a review for any place that we stayed, but felt that I should for this hotel so that others would not have the same disappointing experience that we had on our vacation.My husband and I booked five nights at this hotel in February. We were not expecting anything fancy, but the room that we were given left a lot to be desired. We were provided with a room on the second floor of a two-story building in what the repeat hotel guests called "The Cell Block". It appeared that many of the guests came back year after year. They were very friendly and helpful about the hotel, and the area in general. The room was advertised as a one bedroom apartment. As soon as we walked into the "apartment", we knew that we made a mistake. The room was very small, plain and old. Although, we usually don't worry too much about the room as long as it is clean and nicely appointed since we don't spend much time in a room, it was a bit claustrophobic. Guests should also not expect much in the way of amenities in these rooms. The kitchen was on what was once a screened in porch. The kitchen cabinets were old, and in disrepair. There were two plates, two cups, and a few utensils in the kitchen. The room was air conditioned with a window unit that stuck out in the "kitchen" so that the hot air was blowing on you when you were in that "room". We went to the office, and explained that we were not happy with our room. I have to say that the hotel office staff could not have been any nicer about the situation. I expect that we were not the first to have this issue. We had to pay for the room for one night, and they said that we could cancel our reservation for the remainder of the week. They offered us a two bedroom apartment which was in the back of the resort or a suite at the same price that we paid. We took the suite which was very basic, but much nicer It also had a very nice view of the ocean, and a wonderful porch to sit out on to eat or relax while watching the surf. The suite was only available for that night. so we booked the hotel next door, and moved the next morning. The beach in this area is nice, but very narrow, and was really washed away in front of the hotel. The sunsets at this location are awesome!

Reviews.Title: “great if you are going for a week...apartments sleeping 3 for $130 a night”
Reviews.Author: rbrown333
Reviews.Content: for one or two nights it seemed too expensive and not as nice as Rincon of the Seas...yet if you want to stay longer they have rooms with kitchens which is great...the AC worked great...has a great playground for kids, nice pool, steps from the beach, internet access and right next door you can rent kayaks and jet skies...

Reviews.Title: “Found a new family here.....”
Reviews.Author: GrammaP
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in Puerto Rico for a few days after a cruise and chose the closest place on the Caribbean coast, Rincon. Thanks to Trip Advisor, Villa Antonio sounded like just what we wanted, and we were not disappointed. The very first day, after a 2 1/2 hr drive from San Juan, we went to the pool and asked some folks basking in the sun there for a nearby grocery. Soon we found ourselves with a new family of friends, going to one unit for ice cream social, to the deck over the ocean for "sunset toasting", and to a great potluck and cocktail party hosted by the owner. These folks have been coming to Villa Antonio, some for over 40 years. Everyone, including staff and owner, were friendly, helpful and charming. The Parador is older, but very clean, and fully outfitted if we had wanted to cook. The ocean was a step away, and the grounds were lovely. Bad points? Well, not anyone's fault that the normally flat ocean in front of the hotel was affected by heavy storms in the U.S. and was almost unswimmable, until you got outside the surf line. The folks there recommended a public beach a few miles south and it was protected, deserted and wonderful. The hotel pool was a bit chilly, but then, it was winter. Everything was great, from a coin laundry on site to wireless internet. We would love to go back again someday, despite the REALLY long trip from Oregon.

Reviews.Title: “The place is solely for the locals!”
Reviews.Author: giacomo513
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting this part of the Island since childhood. It had been 12yrs since my last visit. Wow...how things change! We stayed at the Villa Antonio Beach front cottage #5... roll out of bed and on to the beach. That was what we paid for and nothing else. This place is primarily a vacation destination for the locals who visit from various parts of the island. They know the drill and come fully stocked with beer and loud music! Don't be fooled by the online photos. Where do i begin...entering the gates you soon get a feel for how the rest of the stay is going to proceed...the staff is friendly and helpful, however that is where it ends. The room was "depressing" the furniture was old and dingy. everthing from the curtains, bedding, toilet seat, appliances, cutlery , eating table and chairs were just gross! Once the children saw the beach there was no getting out of this one. I had to track down a maid and ask her for a mop and broom and some disinfectant at which time I cleaned the place myself. It was difficult to understand why such a prime located property was in such poor condition. Who is in charge of maintenace here? And why are they still employed? I suggest they get it together and make some serious changes. The place has so much potential , they need to clean house! A little paint would do wonders and some new furniture from a local wholesaler would be a welcomed addition. The rooms condition was simply unexceptable! So fellow travels....Don't go into this place with high expectations! It is what it is! Maria Pennsylvania, USA

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, dirty, and uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: ShutterGo
Reviews.Content: Based on the other views we expected basic, but acceptable. We've stayed at paradors before and found them enjoyable, but this was unbearable. The rooms were dirty, noisy, and surrounded by smokers. The basic room consists of a bedroom and a screened in porch with a kitchen. Unfortunately, if you choose air conditioning for the bedroom, it exhausts the hot air into the kitchen/porch through an AC unit covered with dust and mold. On the first floor were a number of retired couples who had clearly moved in for the winter and there were constant cooking smells. The beach is lovely, but on the second morning, a school bus pulled into the driveway and let 30 people off to have a picnic in the pavilion on the beach- complete with loud radios, laughter, more smoking, and filling up all the space to sit. This would have been okay for the public beach down the road, but not at this private property. It was impossible to read a book, much less relax. At night, the security guards walked around (also smoking) and with their walkie talkies blaring. We could only tolerate 2 nights of our planned 4 day stay and left. The rooms not only had a lot of sand on the floor but there was also a layer of grime every where. The management needs to decide whether they are going to be a hotel/resort for tourists from North America or a place for locals to party and retired people to live for the winter.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach location”
Reviews.Author: Debbie_F
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a 2 bedroom "beachfront cottage" for 4 nights in mid October. The "cottage" is a little misleading as it is not free standing - the building is actually a 4-plex of 2 bedroom units, but it is beach front. The owners keep the property well maintained. The interior of the rooms could use a little work. The kitchen/living room/dining room is a bit small to prepare large scale meals - and you will need to bring your own pots and pans. However, it is great for breakfast, lunch and snacks. The bedrooms were also small, but we spent little time there. Each bedroom has a window unit air conditioner, which we used for 2 of the 4 nights. The breeze from the sea was sufficient to keep the room cool for the 2 other nights. The patio is incredibly large and where we spent most of our time. The breeze from the ocean was cool, and if there had been hooks for a hammock, we might have slept outdoors. Lighting on the patio was bright enough so you could sit outside in the evenings and read. The beach in front of the parador is great for swimming. The waves sound huge, but are small - they just break close to shore. One of the reasons for not turning on the a/c is to be able to listen to the surf at night. Bring your own beach towel. The Villa Cofresi is on one side of the Villa Antonio and we enjoyed dinner there. However, there was a large group there and it was incredibly noisey. We were so happy we were not staying there. The Rincon of the Seas is on the other side. It was also nice for dinner. The entire Rincon area was very quiet - it appeared to us that many of the hotels/guest houses were practically empty. Many of the restaurants were closed, as were the many of the surf shops. Apparently, a number of places close in September and then reopen in late October/early November. We looked for a handicraft store, but did not find one. The Lazy Parrot has some handicrafts and jewelry and Casa Islena had a very very small amount. The first day we were there, there was surf in front of Tamboo Tavern, but it was flat the rest of the time. So, if you like quiet, October is a good time to go and the Villa Antonio is a great place to stay. Based on our tour of town and other places, we would choose to stay at the Villa Antonio on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Come Back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Parador Villa Antonio is the BEST place to stay if you want to relax on the beach for a few days. The hotel is right on the beach and the rooms each have kitchens which is great. I would recommend renting a car so you can take advantage of the local supermarkets. The Parador is definitely not luxury but it has all you could need with AC and television and is really great for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay at Villa Antonio”
Reviews.Author: jfkurose
Reviews.Content: I spent two very enjoyable days here at Villa Antonio (Iâ€™m typing this review connected to an Ethernet hub available in their social room, taking the time to do so since I've had such a nice stay). The place is right on the beach. As another reviewer noted, you can open your windows a listen to the waves on the beach, and walk out your door and be on the beach in 30 seconds. The place is quiet and peaceful, and feels like a place that time forgot, with a bit of a 1960â€™s feel. Iâ€™d guess that the guests here this week are mostly retired but are very friendly; Iâ€™m guessing theyâ€™re returning guests year after year. There are optional social events here. Last night was pot-luck dinner night (bring a dish to share with others); tonight is movie night. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. They just won an award (4th place in all of Puerto Rico) for the best front-office reception. The pool is small, but the Carribean (20 meters from the pool) is huge. The little kitchenettes (complete with coffee maker) are quite convenient. If youâ€™re looking for a party atmosphere or a fancy resort, this isnâ€™t the place, as other reviewers have noted. But if you want a clean, extremely friendly, quiet, and inexpensive place on a beautiful beach, this is it. Iâ€™d definitely come back again. Some recommendations: Cabo Rojo (a nature preserve about an hour south, for deserted beaches, some hiking trails, and informational museum with friendly staff who can tallk you about the process of getting salt out of the salt flats), and Steps Beach (a national preserve in Rincon about 10 minutes north with excellent snorkeling, with reef fish and various coral right off the beach).

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy, but clean, quiet and cheap!”
Reviews.Author: rbrooks24
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for luxurious accommodations... Pay $50+ per night and go next door to Rincon of the Seas. If you want a comfortable, peaceful and quiet stay for a reasonable price, Villa Antonio's the place. It's an older property, but the room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. The kitchenette with coffee maker, fridge and stove was nice to have. There were plates and silverwear, but you have to bring your own napkins, dish soap and sponge if you plan on doing any cooking. Still, we were only about 30 steps from the beautiful sandy beach, and just a short walk you can go to the Rincon of the Seas (which looked nice but a bit stuffy, and the karaoke bar turned us off) and on the other side is the Villa Cofresi, which looks like a fun (but loud) place to go and hang out for a few hours before going back to your quiet room at Villa Antonio. The location within the town is excellent too, just a couple of minutes away from the supermarket and excellent restaurants and of course, Rincon's gorgeous beaches. I'd definitely return to Villa Antonio.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed the hotel but it depends...”
Reviews.Author: bobretired
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an "american hotel" then this is not the place to stay. Stay at the Rincon of the Seas next door. Both are on the beach which in the summer months was great for a nice dip and swim. The best way to describe this hotel is like an upscale RV park and your room is the RV. They supply the room bedding and towels and furnishings and you provide the rest. We rented a two bedroom for 3 days and were 75 steps from the beach. The setting made you feel in puerto rico not usa. This was great for us because our daughter had a seperate room and we had a living room and balcony to lounge in on our return from day trips. It was a relaxing place to stay. Restaurants were a short drive away and the nearby bakery had nice pastries and a cheap breakfast. The accomodations could use some updating but the location and serenity were great. JUST A NOTE THIS HOTEL IS RIGHT ON THE BEACH. WHEN PICKING A PLACE BE SURE ITS ON NOT NEAR THE BEACH some descriptions are confunsing. IN THE THREE DAYS WE WERE HERE WE DROVE ALL OVER THE WEST COAST AND ENJOYED DIFFERENT BEACAHES EACH DAY. No regrets for staying here it was just what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “An ok place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok, we arrive at the Villa Antonio and it is arround 90Âº F and humid, we checked into our room with out any problems. We entered the room and we were a little surprised, the T.V. was missing channel change buttons, and there was no silverware(room had oven, stove, fridge, sink). Although the hotel did have wireless internet it was down apon arrival and did not work until later the next day. If you are planning to go diving in the area I would probably go to Taino Divers, they are very friendly but, be sure to reserve dives early because they can fill up in a matter of hours. Otherwise it was an "ok" hotel, the best resturants in the area by far are the Rincon of the Seas (the hotel next doors resturant) and the Lazy Parrot with a very friendly staff. (to our surprise the very crowded pool closes at 6 at night). If possible I would reccomend staying at the rincon if the seas next door it is very nice and the pool is WAY better, the hotel is a lot nicer and the price is not too much more i recall about $20-$30 dollars a night more. Also be careful on the roads of Rincon the drivers are very wild, fast, spastic and out of control.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay. Inexpensive.”
Reviews.Author: RobertM
Reviews.Content: This parador is nothing fancy, but for a basic accommodation right on the ocean, you can't beat its facilities and price. The beachfront suites and jr. suites are the places to stay. We got a suite for only $130. We were about 40' from the waterline. You could hear the waves crashing over the hum of the air conditioning at night. Clear view of the setting sun directly in front of you off the private balcony. The Rincon of the Seas is right next door, and though it is a completely different type of experience (sterile, resort-like), it is twice the price, and more setback from the water. The rooms are very clean and spacious here. The staff couldn't be friendlier. There was a basketball court, tennis court, and pool, but we didn't use them. Free internet access in their gameroom, as well as additional ports if you have a laptop. We stayed there early March 2005 and the beaches were nearly deserted, though that could be different on weekends, as this area south of Rincon is a favorite weekend and vacationing spot for Puerto Ricans. Most of the guests were retired Americans, the staff told me some of them stay for months and come every year. It is a very quiet place, if you want activity, stay on the north side of Rincon. The beach is relatively calm, but be careful with rocks near the shoreline, the entire coastline here is rocky, but certainly swim-able. The beach is somewhat narrow with alot of other accommodations as far as the eye can see. Explore some of the other nice beaches such as escalera (steps) beach, a short drive away. You can also snorkel there. Next door to the parador on the other side is Villa Confresi, which has an outdoor bar, have a "pirata," a coconut and rum drink served in a coconut. One good thing about being at the parador is that you don't have to hear the music from this bar at night. Nearby across from the Rincon of the Seas exit is an excellent restaurant recommended by the staff, Rincon Tropical, with an exceptional whole red snapper (chillo) deep fried and topped with creole sauce (salsa criolla entomatada). Pick up eggs, bacon, and toast in the morning at the EC Bakery nearby for only $1.75 or cook on the kitchenette in your room. Our time here topped off an excellent vacation, we are already planning our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful days, gorgeous sunsets in Rincon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After a terrible bout with Winter in New England, Rincon was the perfect escape for my boyfriend and I in Jan '4. We stayed at the Parador for two reasons- cost and proximity to the beach. We were pleasantly surprised by the friendliness of the guests and staff. The apartment-style accommodations gave us a sense of freedom and flexibility when it came to meals and relaxing indoors. The beach is literally on the property and although small, it is quiet and perfect for sun-bathing and gentle wave-riding. There is an excellent taco stand across the street with an adjoining liquor store- stock up on Bacardi, it is cheap! We made our own drinks and had moon-lit chats on the beach...very romantic. Make sure you catch the sun-set on the deck at the Parador; BYOB and snacks to share- you'll get to know the other guests. The grocery store is less than half mile away and the prices are extremely reasonable. It helps save on breakfast and snack items. The Guest Services at the Parador will procure fresh fish for you, should you want to make dinner. They are very helpful and knowledgeable about the area and how to maximize the fun of your stay. Highly recommend staying in Rincon, no matter what. A great beach town, very laid back and very beautiful. Other places to check out: The Spot bar and restaurant. Also, www.iloverinconpr.com for other reviews & places to go. HAVE FUN!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Rincon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two week vacation in Puerto Rico and spent the first 5 days at the Parador Villa Antonio in Rincon. The parador has a great location -- very close to the center of town, restaurants, shopping, and of course the surfing beaches. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the daily maid service was flexible about working around our schedule. We stayed in the two bedroom beachfront villa for $145 per night -- a good value for Rincon, which can be a bit pricey. The furnishings were a little worn around the edges, but the rooms were clean and quiet, and the A/C and everything else worked OK. The mosquitoes were a bit of a problem, but you quickly learned to keep the screen door shut. The kitchenette included a full-size refrigerator, stove, pots, pans and utensils; we bought food at the local supermarket and made our own breakfast and lunch every day which saved us money. The beach in front of the parador was kept clean and was great for walking; the ocean sunsets were magnificent. The pool was a bit small, but it was always clean and usually not crowded. There are two tennis courts, at least one of which was always available. The parador does not have a restaurant, but there are quite a few good restaurants within walking distance or a short drive. The hotel next door has a great beachfront bar. The surfing beaches are only 5 to 10 minutes away by car; we found the best waves at Maria's Beach and Domes. We were among just a few US mainland tourists staying at the parador; the majority of its customers appeared to be well-to-do Puerto Rican families from San Juan or elsewhere around the island. We found Rincon and the Parador Villa Antonio to be very relaxing and enjoyable, and we would certainly go back there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Parador Villa Antonio
HotelInfo.Address: Road 115, Km 12.3, Rincon 00677, Puerto Rico
